item.title: Fortnite Festival Season 13: Release Date, Start Times & Headline Act
item.content:encoded:
Fortnite continues to roll out new content, and the latest major drop is set to be the start of Fortnite Festival Season 13, bringing a new headline act onto the stage.

The current season, headlined by LISA, is on the cusp of ending, and Insider Gaming has all the details on her successor, along with the Fortnite Festival Season 13 release date and start times.

What is The Fortnite Festival Season 13 Release Date?

Fortnite Festival Season 13 is set to kick off on Thursday, February 5, landing alongside the next major update in Chapter 7, Season 1.

Downtime will take place ahead of the launch of the new Fortnite Festival season, where Epic Games will also be adding new collabs and cosmetics in the Item Shop, along with potential additions to the main Battle Royale mode.

The launch of Season 13 will introduce a new Festival Pass, offering both free and premium rewards.

What is Fortnite Festival Season 13’s Start Time?

An official start time for Fortnite Festival Season 13 has not been announced, though we do know it will be available when servers are back up after the February 5 patch.

Downtime for Fortnite usually begins at 1 AM PT/4 AM ET and lasts between two and three hours. However, in some situations, downtime can be longer, particularly for larger updates or if an issue is discovered.

Expect Season 13 to be accessible around 4 AM PT/7 AM ET, and keep an eye on social media for news on when the game is back up.

Who is The Fortnite Festival Season 13 Headline Act?

Epic Games has not officially announced the Fortnite Festival Season 13 headline act, though it’s widely understood to be Chappel Roan.

Hints uncovered earlier this month include a Pink Pony Club makeover to Fortnite’s iconic llama, along with a new microphone and drumset found by dataminers, all of which could be included as cosmetics in the Festival Pass.

Chappel Roan already has plenty of big hits in Fortnite as Jam Tracks, including the likes of Hot to Go and Good Luck, Babe!

What headline acts do you want to see Fortnite Festival add in the future? Share your thoughts in the Insider Gaming Discord.

For more Fortnite, read about the tease of the Honkai Star Rail collab, and see what Fortnite’s director had to say about plans to ‘spice up’ the current season.

item.title: Nioh 3 Has a Timed Console Exclusivity Deal With Playstation
item.content:encoded:
Koei Tecmo has made Nioh 3 a timed console exclusive, with the game only available on PlayStation 5 until August 2026.

Nioh 3, the latest action-RPG, is all set to release for PlayStation 5 and PC via Steam on February 6, 2026. Ahead of the launch, we have been told that the developers have backed up the demo, and players will be able to carry over the progress to the full game. Now, details on console exclusivity have been revealed.

Nioh 3 is Exclusive on PS5 Until August 2026

Revealed through a new PlayStation 5 features video, Nioh 3 is a timed console exclusive on the platform. The game will not be available on any other console at least until 6 months after February 6, 2026. Post that the developers can plan an Xbox Series X/S launch; however, that release date hasn’t been specified yet.

Coming to the PlayStation 5 features for Nioh 3, firstly, players will be able to take in all the game’s breathtaking visuals in 4K (a 4K display is required). There’s full-fledged haptic feedback, so you can feel enemy hits exactly from the direction they are hitting from, along with vibrations for different interactions.

Moreover, adaptive triggers will be included for added immersion, with different levels of resistance for archery and gunshots. Lastly, there’s 3D audio, letting you hear sounds from where they originate in the game.

In other news, check out Insider Gaming’s guide on the review embargo for Nioh 3. Additionally, here’s what you need to know about the game’s demo and early access status. What are your thoughts on Nioh 3 being a timed console exclusive on the PlayStation 5? Leave your thoughts down in the comments, and join the official Insider Gaming Discord server.

For more information from Insider Gaming, read about Embark Studios spending $75 million to develop and market ARC Raiders. Don’t forget to sign up for our weekly newsletter.

item.title: ARC Raiders Budget Was $75 Million, It’s Claimed
item.content:encoded:
An analyst has claimed that Embark Studios made ARC Raiders on a $75 million budget, including marketing.

ARC Raiders is easily one of the most popular titles from 2025, with Embark Studios hitting it out of the park with their new extraction adventure. The title also received a massive update recently, which broke some systems but added a lot of new content. However, today we aren’t talking about that; instead, we are talking about how much it costs to make the game.

ARC Raiders Budget Reportedly Revealed

In the latest SIFTD Games video, industry analyst Michael Pachter revealed the budget for ARC Raiders. The new video explores whether Ubisoft will survive after the recent restructuring announcement, with Patcher sharing his insights on several topics. Towards the end of the video, Patcher discusses different game budgets and timelines, where the cost of making ARC Raiders was revealed.

Patcher states that Ubisoft taking 5 years to develop a game and selling only 5 million units is not sustainable; “3 years is plenty.” He then talks about people bringing Rockstar into comparison, which might be $1.5-2 billion on GTA 6, but don’t understand that “they are going to make that $2 billion back in the first week.”

The analyst adds that everybody shouldn’t be comparing themselves to “GTA, FIFA, or the former glory of Call of Duty,” instead, they should compare themselves to ARC Raiders. Patcher then drops a secret, stating, “ARC Raiders cost $75 million to make.” It was developed over 3 years, had a team of 70 developers, and included marketing in the budget. Patcher added that the game has already made $500 million from 12 million-plus units sold and will “probably” make close to a billion.

In other news, Embark Studios revealed that ARC Raiders faced “extensive, coordinated DDoS attacks” recently. Additionally, here’s a guide to completing all the trials for this week (February 2). What are your thoughts on the ARC Raiders’ budget being $75 million? Leave your thoughts down in the comments, and join the official Insider Gaming Discord server.

For more information from Insider Gaming, read about the Escape from Tarkov anti-cheat plea gaining community traction. Don’t forget to sign up for our weekly newsletter.
